executive_summary: New car dealers are highly susceptible to changes in the economic environment. Weak consumer confidence, disposable income and corporate profit during the pandemic led to sharp declines in 2020; lockdown restrictions also limited driving and travel activity, contributing to weak demand for new cars and repair services. However, rising incomes and rebounding confidence have supported the industry's recovery. Demand for new vehicles has tempered since, as rising interest rates have increased the cost of buying on credit while the broader economy has begun to normalize. Nonetheless, revenue has climbed at an expected CAGR of 1.5% to an estimated $1.2 trillion through the current period, including a 0.4% jump in 2024, where profit will reach 1.8%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Dealers Have Faced Major Supply Chain Disruptions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Supply chain issues at the manufacturing and distribution levels stemming from the COVID-19 pandemic led to severe shortages of parts, computer chips, and vehicles during the pandemic's peak. Soaring input prices made new cars significantly more expensive, increasing inventory costs. Similarly, semiconductor and electronic component shortages reduced supply, leaving dealers with limited inventories. Even so, dealers were largely able to leverage torrid demand and pass added costs onto buyers, creating strong revenue growth. Companies have also integrated online services to make the car-buying process simpler and more accessible.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Climbing Interest Rates Have Posed a Major Threat to the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Economic uncertainty has limited revenue growth for new car dealers. Notably, high interest rates have made auto loans more expensive, forcing buyers to pay higher principles and monthly interest payments. These conditions have especially limited lower-income buyers with weaker credit scores.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Services Have Reshaped the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Websites and mobile apps have made browsing for new and used vehicles more convenient, driving vehicle sales.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Improving Economic Conditions Will Facilitate Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: New car dealers will benefit from strengthening economic conditions through the outlook period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Consumer Preferences Will Continue to Evolve
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumer vehicle preferences have rapidly evolved over the past decade, forcing dealers to constantly change inventories.

industry_definition: Businesses in the New Car Dealers industry sell new and used passenger vehicles.
key_trends: New car dealers leverage partnerships to attract customers.
Electric vehicles have increased in popularity.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Represents consumers' general outlook on the economy.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is the most populated region in the US.
The Mid-Atlantic region has a dense population.

regulations_points.regulation_description: States mandate car dealers to acquire proper licenses.

basis_points.basis_description: New car dealers leverage car brand partnerships.

concentration_points.concentration_description: New car dealers face few restrictive entry barriers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Inventory purchases are the largest expense for a new car dealership.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Major supply chain disruptions can limit vehicle production.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Dealers are adopting new technologies for efficiency.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a specific type of vehicle or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Companies typically sell all types of vehicles.
